A clean fruiting zone is especially critical to grapes that have high pyrazine content like these Cabernet Franc bunches. Pyrazine contributes green bell pepper characteristic to wine, and while we love that as a sub-note we don't want it to dominate. Deleafing early allows for the grapes to ease into full sun as they change color (veraison pics coming soon!) and sunlight causes the green pepper flavors to dissipate. ‚Å†‚Å†üçá

‚Å†
2020 Ros√©: The pale, salmon color primes us for the strawberries, white peaches, red grapefruit, and herbal aromas of this wine. The acidity matches the texture and brings freshness to the fruit, and the wine lingers with a pleasant citrus pith character. ‚Å†

2020 Young Red: Chambourcin is a grape that if you try to make it taste like vinifera, will end up similar to jogging with a cat on a leash. You can do it, but it‚Äôs going to be weird, some folks may disapprove, and it will get its revenge while you sleep (the cat will). Chambourcin‚Äôs spirit animal is not a cat, but rather some theoretical ‚Äúalways puppy‚Äù with a joy and playfulness all its own. ‚Å†

2020 Young White: It would be silly to over-describe a wine with a questionable owl on the label, but we should point out that this wine has texture and volume while retaining acidic structure, a result of full malo and long contact with active yeast. Vineyard update: We headed up to the top of Quaker Run Vineyard to check in on the vines. ‚Å†‚Å†
‚Å†‚Å†
At this stage in the growing season, there‚Äôs a lot of attention and handwork focused on the canopy to best ensure fully ripe, healthy grapes come harvest. ‚Å†‚Å†
‚Å†‚Å†
First, our vineyard crew removed leaves from the fruiting zone - this allows dappled sunlight to reach the bunches and keep them open to the breezes and free of disease. The shoots have quickly reached the top of the trellising wires and we‚Äôll be hedging to prevent shading and focus ripening energy towards grapes, not leaves. For the cover crops and growth between the vines, we gently crimp to encourage the buildup of organic material in the soils. Now it‚Äôs countdown to veraison, when the grapes will change from bright green to either red or golden as they gather sugars and head towards harvest. ‚Å†‚Å†
